1    EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:



?    California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

?    Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

?    California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

?    Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Madera Power has elected to use PSMWriter©, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1    MADERA POWER, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM 



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Madera Power has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Ammonia Process    | Anhydrous Ammonia | 60,000 lb



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of ammonia. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.



Madera Power has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 



1.    Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2.    Organized the

program so that it meshes closely with general Madera Power business practices

3.    Utilized PSMWriter© software to ensure that all necessary Madera Power employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.



1.2    PROCESS DESCRIPTIONS



Madera Power injects anhydrous ammonia into the fluid bed combustor to provide control of NOx emissions.  Ammonia gas is piped from a storage tank through a control valve (which is controlled by the NOx emissions), where it mixes with forced air in a duct.  The air-ammonia mixture flows into the combustor.



1.3    GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



1.3.1    GENERAL 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Madera Power has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in the body of the program. 



1.3.2    ANHYDROUS AMMONIA



The ammonia process at the Madera Power facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



1.4    FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Madera Power has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5    EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN



Madera Power's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:



?    C

alifornia "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

?    Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 

?    California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

?    Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Our company has an outstanding safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Many policies and procedures have been implemented to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Madera Power continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter© software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Madera Power's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter© tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Madera Power's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Madera Power has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter©, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter© as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter©.



In addition

to utilizing PSMWriter© to create, schedule, track, and document events, Madera Power has also entered into a contract with California Controlled Atmosphere to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation. A copy of California Controlled Atmosphere's service agreement has been included in this program with the support material.



Madera Power thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Madera Power employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Madera Power will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
